revised_title: Agricultural and Botanical Analysis of Permanent Meadow Herbage
tldr: This article presents the botanical results of a long-term experiment on the mixed herbage of permanent meadows. The authors describe the normal botanical composition of the herbage and the changes induced by different manuring agents and climatic conditions. They also discuss the characteristics of individual dominant plants and the botany of each plot, highlighting the plants' ability to maintain themselves or succumb in competition.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Agriculture and Soil Management
